pycharmm.cdocker

Functions for standard CDOCKER calcualtion

Created by Yujin Wu (wyujin@umich.edu)

See CHARMM documentation openmm_dock and GRID for more information

Functions

  • calc_dihedral -- calculate dihedral angles for a given four position
  • rand_rot_trans -- random translate and rotate of the ligand
  • FACTS_rescore -- FACTS rescoring of docked poses
  • RCDOCKER_init_place -- rigid CDOCKER original initial placement
  • RCDOCKER_fast_init_place -- rigid CDOCKER fast initial placement
  • FCDOCKER_init_place -- flexible CDOCKER initial placement
  • FCDOCKER_fast_init_place -- flexible CDOCKER fast initial placement
  • FCDOCKER_mutation -- mutation in the genetic algorithm in flexible CDOCKER
  • FCDOCKER_crossover -- crossover in the genetic algorithm in flexible CDOCKER
  • FCDOCKER_calc_dihedral -- calculate dihedral angles in flexible CDOCKER
  • default_ommd_sian -- default simulated annealing algorithm
  • cluster_mmtsb -- clustering with mmtsb cluster.pl
  • scan_cluster_radius -- find best cluster radius
  • rcdocker_default_sort -- default rigid cdocker sort method
  • top_N_cluster -- find top N cluster result
  • Rigid_CDOCKER -- standard rigid CDOCKER docking method
  • Flexible_CDOCKER -- standard flexible CDOCKER docking method

Examples

Import Rigid_CDOCKER module to perform rigid CDOCKER using the standard protocol

>>> from pycharmm.cdocker import Rigid_CDOCKER

With default input, users only need to provide grid box information

>>> Rigid_CDOCKER(xcen = 1, ycen = 1, zcen = 1, maxlen = 10)

Import Flexible_CDOCKER to perform flexible CDOCKER using the standard protocol

>>> from pycharmm.cdocker import Flexible_CDOCKER

With default input, users only need to provide grid box information and flexible side chain selection

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> flex={'res_id': [84, 87, 99, 111, 118], 'seg_id': ['PROT', 'PROT', 'PROT', 'PROT', 'PROT']}
>>> flexchain = pd.DataFrame(data=flex) 
>>> print(flexchain)
   res_id seg_id
0      84   PROT
1      87   PROT
2      99   PROT
3     111   PROT
4     118   PROT
>>> Flexible_CDOCKER(xcen = 1, ycen = 1, zcen = 1, maxlen = 10, flexchain = flexchain)

  17"""Functions for standard CDOCKER calcualtion
  18
  19Created by Yujin Wu (wyujin@umich.edu)
  20
  21See CHARMM documentation [openmm_dock](<https://academiccharmm.org/documentation/version/c47b1>)
  22and [GRID](<https://academiccharmm.org/documentation/version/c47b1/grid>)
  23for more information
  24
  25Functions
  26=========
  27- `calc_dihedral` -- calculate dihedral angles for a given four position
  28- `rand_rot_trans` -- random translate and rotate of the ligand
  29- `FACTS_rescore` -- FACTS rescoring of docked poses
  30- `RCDOCKER_init_place` -- rigid CDOCKER original initial placement
  31- `RCDOCKER_fast_init_place` -- rigid CDOCKER fast initial placement
  32- `FCDOCKER_init_place` -- flexible CDOCKER initial placement
  33- `FCDOCKER_fast_init_place` -- flexible CDOCKER fast initial placement
  34- `FCDOCKER_mutation` -- mutation in the genetic algorithm in flexible CDOCKER
  35- `FCDOCKER_crossover` -- crossover in the genetic algorithm in flexible CDOCKER
  36- `FCDOCKER_calc_dihedral` -- calculate dihedral angles in flexible CDOCKER
  37- `default_ommd_sian` -- default simulated annealing algorithm
  38- `cluster_mmtsb` -- clustering with mmtsb cluster.pl
  39- `scan_cluster_radius` -- find best cluster radius
  40- `rcdocker_default_sort` -- default rigid cdocker sort method
  41- `top_N_cluster` -- find top N cluster result
  42- `Rigid_CDOCKER` -- standard rigid CDOCKER docking method
  43- `Flexible_CDOCKER` -- standard flexible CDOCKER docking method
  44
  45Examples
  46========
  47Import `Rigid_CDOCKER` module to perform rigid CDOCKER using the standard protocol
  48>>> from pycharmm.cdocker import Rigid_CDOCKER
  49
  50With default input, users only need to provide grid box information
  51>>> Rigid_CDOCKER(xcen = 1, ycen = 1, zcen = 1, maxlen = 10)
  52
  53Import `Flexible_CDOCKER` to perform flexible CDOCKER using the standard protocol
  54>>> from pycharmm.cdocker import Flexible_CDOCKER
  55
  56With default input, users only need to provide grid box information and flexible side chain selection
  57>>> import pandas as pd
  58>>> flex={'res_id': [84, 87, 99, 111, 118], 'seg_id': ['PROT', 'PROT', 'PROT', 'PROT', 'PROT']}
  59>>> flexchain = pd.DataFrame(data=flex) 
  60>>> print(flexchain)
  61   res_id seg_id
  620      84   PROT
  631      87   PROT
  642      99   PROT
  653     111   PROT
  664     118   PROT
  67>>> Flexible_CDOCKER(xcen = 1, ycen = 1, zcen = 1, maxlen = 10, flexchain = flexchain)
  68

  94def _mkdir_(fileName):
  95    """Bash command for removing folder and creating folder
  96
  97    Parameters
  98    ----------
  99    fileName: str
 100               name for the new folder
 101
 102    Returns
 103    -------
 104    bool: true for success
 105    """
 106    cmd = '''rm -rf %s''' % (str(fileName))
 107    system(cmd)
 108    cmd = '''mkdir -p %s''' % (str(fileName))
 109    system(cmd)
 110    return True

 164def _mutate_prob_(DEner):
 165    """Calculate mutation probability based on energy difference
 166
 167    Parameters
 168    ----------
 169    DEner: float
 170            energy differnce
 171    
 172    Returns
 173    -------
 174    float: mutation probability
 175    """
 176    if DEner <= 0:
 177        return 1 - 0.5 * exp(DEner)
 178    else:
 179        return 0.5 * exp(-DEner)
 180
 181## Flexible docking side dihedral angle and entropy calculation
 182protein_dihedral = pd.DataFrame()
 183tmp_aa = ['ARG', 'ARG', 'ARG', 'ARG', 'ASN',
 184   'ASN', 'ASP', 'ASP', 'CSY', 'GLN', 'GLN',

 192   'CA CB CG OD1', 'N CA CB SG', 'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG CD',

 194   'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG ND1', 'N CA CB CG1', 'CA CB CG1 CD',
 195   'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG CD1', 'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG CD',
 196   'CB CG CD CE', 'CG CD CE NZ', 'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG SD',
 197   'CB CG SD CE', 'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG CD1', 'N CA CB OG',
 198   'N CA CB OG1', 'N CA CB CG', 'CA CB CG CD1', 'N CA CB CG',
 199   'CA CB CG CD1', 'N CA CB CG1']
 200protein_dihedral['Amino_acid'] = tmp_aa
 201protein_dihedral['Side_chain_atom'] = tmp_sc

 203def calc_dihedral(xyz):
 204    """Calculate dihedral angle entropy contribution 
 205
 206    Parameters
 207    ----------
 208    xyz: numpy 4 by 3 array 
 209          4 points in xyz-coordinates
 210    
 211    Returns
 212    -------
 213    float
 214          dihedral angles in degree
 215    """
 216    v1 = xyz[1, :] - xyz[0, :]
 217    v2 = xyz[2, :] - xyz[1, :]
 218    v3 = xyz[3, :] - xyz[2, :]
 219
 220    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1)
 221    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2)
 222    v3 = v3 / np.linalg.norm(v3)
 223
 224    n1 = np.cross(v1, v2)
 225    n2 = np.cross(v2, v3)
 226    m1 = np.cross(n1, v2)
 227
 228    x = n1 @ n2
 229    y = m1 @ n2
 230
 231    rad = atan2(y, x)
 232    return rad / pi * 180
 233
 234## Random rotation & translation function
 235def rand_rot_trans(xyz, max_rot = pi, max_trans = 2):
 236    """Random rotation and translation of the ligand
 237
 238    Parameters
 239    ----------
 240    xyz: np.array 
 241          n by 3 array (i.e., xyz coordinates) 
 242    max_rot: float 
 243              maximum rotation angle (in radian) 
 244    max_trans: float 
 245                maximum translation 
 246    
 247    Returns
 248    -------
 249    np.array
 250         new ligand xyz coordinates 
 251    """
 252    ## Get random rotation angle and translation distance
 253    tmp = np.random.rand(2, 3) * 2 - 1
 254    rand_trans = tmp[0, :] * max_trans
 255    rot_vec = tmp[1, :] / np.linalg.norm(tmp[1, :])
 256    max_rot = max_rot * (random() * 2 - 1)
 257    matrix = R.from_rotvec(rot_vec * max_rot).as_matrix()
 258
 259    ## Random rotation and translation
 260    ligCenter = (np.amin(xyz, axis = 0) + np.amax(xyz, axis = 0)) / 2
 261    origin_xyz = xyz - ligCenter
 262    tmp_xyz = origin_xyz @ matrix.T + ligCenter + rand_trans
 263    return tmp_xyz 
 264
 265## FACTS implicit solvent rescoring
 266def FACTS_rescore(fixAtomSel = None, steps = 1000, tolgrd = 0.001):
 267    """Default FACTS docking rescore method
 268
 269    Parameters
 270    ----------
 271    fixAtomSel : pycharmm.SelectAtoms
 272                 fixed atoms that undergoes FACTS implicit solvent minimization
 273    steps : int 
 274            number of minimization steps
 275    tolgrd : float
 276             minimization tolerance (exit thresold)
 277
 278    Returns
 279    -------
 280    facts_ener : float
 281                FACTS implicit solvent energy 
 282    """
 283
 284    ## Non-bond option
 285    lingo.charmm_script("faster on")
 286    update_nonbond = pycharmm.UpdateNonBondedScript(
 287     nbxmod = 5, atom = True, cdiel = True, eps = 1, shift = True,
 288     vatom = True, vdistance = True, vswitch = True, cutnb = 14.0, 
 289     ctofnb = 12.0, ctonnb = 10.0, e14fac = 1.0, wmin = 1.5).run()
 290    lingo.charmm_script("scalar wmain = radius")
 291
 292    ## FACTS implicit solvent setup
 293    FACTS(tcps = 22, teps = 1, gamm = 0.015, 
 294     tavw = True, conc = 0.1, temp = 298).run()
 295
 296    ## Minimiziation 
 297    if fixAtomSel != None: cons_fix.setup(fixAtomSel)
 298    minimize.run_abnr(nstep = steps, tolgrd = tolgrd)
 299    if fixAtomSel != None: cons_fix.turn_off()
 300
 301    ## Get energy
 302    energy.show()
 303    facts_ener = energy.get_total()
 304    return facts_ener
 305
 306## Grids for fast ligand initial placement in rigid receptor
 307def _fill_grid(atomCoor, size):
 308    """Filling in grids
 309
 310    Parameters
 311    ----------
 312    atomCoor : np.array 
 313               n by 3 array (i.e., xyz coordinates)
 314    size : int 
 315           size of the grid boxes
 316    
 317    Returns
 318    -------
 319    numpy 3d array: grid for fast ligand initial placement 
 320    """
 321    filled_grid = np.zeros([int(size) + 1, int(size) + 1, int(size) + 1])
 322    filled_grid[atomCoor[:, 0], atomCoor[:, 1], atomCoor[:, 2]] += 1
 323    atomCoor = atomCoor - 1
 324    filled_grid[atomCoor[:, 0], atomCoor[:, 1], atomCoor[:, 2]] += 1
 325    return filled_grid
 326
 327def _prot_grid(protCoor):
 328    """Filling in protein grids for fast initial placement 
 329
 330    Parameters
 331    ----------
 332    protCoor: np.array 
 333               n by 3 array (i.e., xyz coordinates)
 334    
 335    Returns
 336    -------
 337    float size: size of the grid boxes
 338    numpy 3d array: protein grid for fast ligand initial placement 
 339    """
 340    minCoor = np.amin(protCoor, axis = 0)
 341    maxCoor = np.amax(protCoor, axis = 0)
 342    size = np.ceil(np.max(np.ceil(maxCoor) - np.floor(minCoor))) + 2
 343    atomCoor = np.floor(protCoor + size / 2).astype(int)
 344    protGrid = _fill_grid(atomCoor, size)
 345    return size, protGrid 
 346
 347def _lig_grid(ligCoor, size, protCenter):
 348    """Filling in ligand grids for fast initial placement 
 349
 350    Parameters
 351    ----------
 352    ligCoor: np.array
 353              n by 3 array (i.e., xyz coordinates)
 354    size: int 
 355           size of the grid boxes
 356    protCenter: np.array 
 357                 center of the protein, [Xcenter, Ycenter, Zcenter]
 358    
 359    Returns
 360    -------
 361    numpy 3d array: ligand grid for fast ligand initial placement 
 362    """
 363    atomCoor = np.floor(ligCoor + size / 2 - protCenter).astype(int)
 364    ligGrid = _fill_grid(atomCoor, size)
 365    return ligGrid

 367## Rigid CDOCKER function
 368## Original initial placement method
 369## Fast initial placement method

 371def RCDOCKER_init_place(ligPDB = './ligand.pdb', ligSeg = 'LIGA',
 372                        hardGridFile = 'grid-emax-3-mine--30-maxe-30.bin',
 373                        nativeGridFile = 'grid-emax-100-mine--100-maxe-100.bin',
 374                        confDir = './conformer', placementDir = './placement',
 375                        flag_center_ligand = True, flag_use_hbond = True, 
 376                        flag_form = False, flag_rdie = True, dielec = 3,
 377                        xcen = 0, ycen = 0, zcen = 0, numPlace = 100, threshold = 2500):
 378    """Rigid CDOCKER original initial placement
 379
 380    Parameters
 381    ----------
 382    ligPDB : str
 383             ligand pdb file name
 384    ligSeg : str
 385             ligand segment ID
 386    hardGridFile : str
 387                   hard grid file name
 388    nativeGridFile : str
 389                     native grid file name
 390    confDir : str
 391              conformer folder name
 392    placementDir : str
 393                   placement folder name
 394    flag_center_ligand : bool
 395                         whether ligand needed to be centered or not
 396    flag_use_hbond : bool
 397                     whether hydrogen bond is used in ligand initial placement
 398    flag_form: bool
 399                whether or not the grid file is formatted
 400    flag_rdie: bool
 401                true for rdie, false for cdie 
 402    dielec: float
 403             dielectric constant
 404    xcen : float
 405           center of the docking pocket
 406    ycen : float
 407           center of the docking pocket
 408    zcen : float
 409           center of the docking pocket
 410    numPlace : int
 411               number of placement for each conformer
 412    threshold : float
 413                threshold for energy cutoff
 414
 415    Returns
 416    -------
 417    int
 418        number of conformers
 419    numPlace :  int
 420        number of placement for each conformer
 421    """
 422    ## Prepare
 423    gridCenter = np.asarray([xcen, ycen, zcen])
 424    if psf.get_natom() > 0 : psf.delete_atoms()
 425    read.sequence_pdb(ligPDB)
 426    settings.set_bomb_level(-1)
 427    gen.new_segment(seg_name = ligSeg)
 428    settings.set_bomb_level(0)
 429    read.pdb(ligPDB, resid = True)
 430    ligand = pycharmm.SelectAtoms().by_seg_id(ligSeg)
 431
 432    ## Update nonbond interactions
 433    if flag_rdie:
 434        update_nonbond = pycharmm.UpdateNonBondedScript(
 435          atom = True, switch = True, vswitch = True, vdwe = True,
 436          elec = True, rdie = True, cutnb = 12, ctofnb = 10, ctonnb = 8,
 437          emax = 10000, maxe = 10000, mine = -10000, epsilon = dielec).run()
 438    else:
 439        update_nonbond = pycharmm.UpdateNonBondedScript(
 440          atom = True, switch = True, vswitch = True, vdwe = True,
 441          elec = True, cdie = True, cutnb = 12, ctofnb = 10, ctonnb = 8,
 442          emax = 10000, maxe = 10000, mine = -10000, epsilon = dielec).run()
 443
 444    ## Grid information
 445    hardSet = {'selection' : ligand, 'flag_form' : flag_form, 'gridFile' : 
 446                hardGridFile, 'flag_grhb' : flag_use_hbond}
 447    nativeSet = {'selection' : ligand, 'flag_form' : flag_form, 'gridFile' : 
 448                  nativeGridFile, 'flag_grhb': flag_use_hbond}
 449
 450    ## Loop through conformers
 451    idxCopy = 1
 452    _mkdir_(placementDir)
 453    for conformer in listdir(confDir):
 454        read.pdb(confDir + conformer, resid = True)
 455        minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.01)
 456        minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.005)
 457        totalener = energy.get_total() + threshold
 458        xyz = coor.get_positions().to_numpy()
 459        if flag_center_ligand :
 460            ligCenter = (np.amin(xyz, axis = 0) + np.amax(xyz, axis = 0)) / 2
 461            xyz = xyz - ligCenter + gridCenter
 462            new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(xyz, columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 463            coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
 464
 465        ## Now start placement and save result
 466        idxnum = 1
 467        xyz = coor.get_positions().to_numpy()
 468        while idxnum <= numPlace / 5:
 469
 470            ## Find initial conformer place
 471            new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(rand_rot_trans(xyz), columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 472            coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
 473
 474            ## Minimize in Grids
 475            hardGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
 476            hardGrid.setVar(hardSet)
 477            hardGrid.read()
 478            minimize.run_sd(nstep = 100)
 479            minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 500, tolenr = 0.01)
 480            hardGrid.off()
 481            hardGrid.clear()
 482
 483            nativeGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
 484            nativeGrid.setVar(nativeSet)
 485            nativeGrid.read()
 486            minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50)
 487            minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 100, tolenr = 0.01)
 488
 489            ## Check energy
 490            energy.show()
 491            flag_mutate = False
 492            allEner = energy.get_energy()
 493            confEner = energy.get_total()
 494            if confEner <= totalener : flag_mutate = True
 495            if flag_use_hbond:
 496                dockhbond = energy.get_eterm(111) 
 497                if dockhbond > 0 : flag_mutate = False
 498            nativeGrid.off()
 499            nativeGrid.clear()
 500
 501            if flag_mutate :
 502                tmpidx = 1
 503                randomEner = confEner
 504                while tmpidx <= 5:
 505                    ## Random rotation and translation
 506                    mutate_xyz = pd.DataFrame(rand_rot_trans(new_xyz.to_numpy(), max_rot = pi / 6),
 507                                              columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 508                    coor.set_positions(mutate_xyz)
 509
 510                    ## Minimize in Grids
 511                    hardGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
 512                    hardGrid.setVar(hardSet)
 513                    hardGrid.read()
 514                    minimize.run_sd(nstep = 100)
 515                    minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 500, tolenr = 0.01)
 516                    hardGrid.off()
 517                    hardGrid.clear()
 518
 519                    nativeGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
 520                    nativeGrid.setVar(nativeSet)
 521                    nativeGrid.read()
 522                    minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50)
 523                    minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 100, tolenr = 0.01)
 524
 525                    ## Check energy difference
 526                    DEner = energy.get_total() - confEner
 527                    nativeGrid.off()
 528                    nativeGrid.clear()
 529                    prob = _mutate_prob_(DEner)
 530                    rand = random()
 531
 532                    if rand <= prob:
 533                        print("Rigid CDOCKER ligand original placement", str(idxCopy))
 534                        write.coor_pdb(placementDir + str(idxCopy) + ".pdb", title = '''Title
 535                        * The conformer pdb is %s
 536                        * Placement ID is %d and mutate ID is %d'''
 537                        % (conformer, idxnum, tmpidx))
 538                        idxCopy += 1
 539                        tmpidx += 1
 540
 541                idxnum += 1
 542    return len(listdir(confDir)), numPlace
 543
 544def RCDOCKER_fast_init_place(receptorPDB = './protein.pdb', receptorPSF = './protein.psf',
 545               ligPDB = './ligand.pdb', ligSeg = 'LIGA', confDir = './conformer/', 
 546               placementDir = './placement/',  exhaustiveness = 'high', flag_center_ligand = True,  
 547               xcen = 0, ycen = 0, zcen = 0, numPlace = 100):
 548    """Rigid CDOCKER fast initial placement
 549
 550    Parameters
 551    ----------
 552    receptorPDB: str 
 553              protein pdb file name
 554    receptorPSF: str 
 555              protein psf file name
 556    ligPDB: str
 557             ligand pdb file name
 558    ligSeg: str
 559             ligand segment ID
 560    confDir: str
 561              conformer folder name
 562    placementDir: str
 563                   placement folder name
 564    exhaustiveness: str
 565                     exhaustiveness for fast placement, high, medium, low
 566    flag_center_ligand: bool
 567                         whether or not ligand need to be centered
 568    xcen: float
 569           center of the docking pocket
 570    ycen: float
 571           center of the docking pocket
 572    zcen: float
 573           center of the docking pocket
 574    numPlace: int 
 575               number of placement for each conformer 
 576    
 577    Returns
 578    -------
 579    int
 580        number of conformers
 581    numPlace : int
 582        number of placement for each cnoformer 
 583    """
 584    ## Protein grid information
 585    if psf.get_natom() > 0: psf.delete_atoms()
 586    read.psf_card(receptorPSF, append = True)
 587    read.pdb(receptorPDB, resid = True)
 588    xyz = coor.get_positions().to_numpy()
 589    protCenter = (np.amin(xyz, axis = 0) + np.max(xyz, axis = 0)) / 2 
 590    xyz = xyz - protCenter
 591    size, protGrid = _prot_grid(xyz)
 592
 593    ## Build ligand 
 594    gridCenter = np.asarray([xcen, ycen, zcen]) 
 595    psf.delete_atoms()
 596    read.sequence_pdb(ligPDB)
 597    settings.set_bomb_level(-1)        ## for 3-mem ring
 598    gen.new_segment(seg_name = ligSeg)
 599    settings.set_bomb_level(0)
 600    read.pdb(ligPDB, resid = True)
 601    num_atom = psf.get_natom() 
 602
 603    ## Check cutoff, default is high 
 604    if exhaustiveness == 'high':
 605        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.1) + 1 
 606    elif exhaustiveness == 'medium':
 607        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.2) + 1
 608    elif exhaustiveness == 'low':
 609        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.5) + 1
 610    else:
 611        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.1) + 1 
 612
 613    ## Loop through conformers
 614    idxCopy = 1
 615    _mkdir_(placementDir)
 616    for conformer in listdir(confDir):
 617        read.pdb(confDir + conformer, resid = True)
 618        xyz = coor.get_positions().to_numpy()
 619        if flag_center_ligand:
 620            ligCenter = (np.amin(xyz, axis = 0) + np.amax(xyz, axis = 0)) / 2
 621            xyz = xyz - ligCenter + gridCenter
 622            new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(xyz, columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 623            coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
 624
 625        ## Now start placement and save result
 626        idxnum = 1
 627        while idxnum <= numPlace / 5:
 628
 629            ## Find initial conformer place
 630            tmp_xyz = rand_rot_trans(xyz)
 631            ligGrid = _lig_grid(tmp_xyz, size, protCenter)
 632            conformer_score = np.sum(protGrid * ligGrid)
 633            if conformer_score <= cutoff:
 634                conformer_xyz = tmp_xyz
 635                tmpidx = 1
 636
 637                ## Mutate conformer position, save pose based on probability 
 638                while tmpidx <= 5:
 639                    tmp_xyz = rand_rot_trans(xyz, max_rot = pi / 6, max_trans = 1)
 640                    ligGrid = _lig_grid(tmp_xyz, size, protCenter)
 641                    score = conformer_score - np.sum(protGrid * ligGrid)
 642                    prob = exp(score)
 643                    rand = random()
 644
 645                    if prob > rand: 
 646                        new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(tmp_xyz, columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 647                        coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
 648                        print("Ligand placement ", str(idxCopy))
 649                        write.coor_pdb(placementDir + str(idxCopy) + ".pdb", title = '''Title
 650                        * The conformer pdb is %s 
 651                        * Placement ID is %d and mutate ID is %d and the score is %d
 652                        * The exp(score) is %8.6f and cutoff is %8.6f''' 
 653                        % (conformer, idxnum, tmpidx, score, prob, rand)) 
 654                        tmpidx += 1
 655                        idxCopy += 1
 656                        
 657                idxnum += 1
 658    return len(listdir(confDir)), numPlace
 659
 660##  Flexible CDOCKER functions
 661## 	Initial placement
 662## 	Crossover
 663##	Next generation placement
 664
 665def FCDOCKER_init_place(receptorCard= './flexchain.crd', receptorSel = None, flexSel = None,
 666                        ligSel = None, ligPDB = './ligand.pdb', ligSeg = "LIGA",
 667                        hardGridFile = 'grid-emax-3-mine--30-maxe-30.bin',
 668                        nativeGridFile = 'grid-emax-100-mine--100-maxe-100.bin',
 669                        placementDir = './placement/', num = 20, copy = 25, 
 670                        threshold = 2500, flag_form = False):
 671    """Flexible CDOCKER initial placement
 672
 673    Parameters
 674    ----------
 675    receptorCard: str 
 676                   receptor coordinate card 
 677    receptorSel: str 
 678                  receptor selection 
 679    flexSel: str
 680              flexible part selection
 681    ligSel: str
 682             ligand selection 
 683    ligPDB: str
 684             ligand pdb file name
 685    ligSeg: str
 686             ligand segment ID
 687    hardGridFile: str
 688                   hard grid file name 
 689    nativeGridFile: str
 690                     native grid file name 
 691    placementDir: str
 692                   placement folder name
 693    num: int
 694           number of conformer
 695    copy: int
 696           number of copies for each conformer
 697    threshold: float
 698                threshold for energy cutoff  
 699    flag_form: bool
 700                whether or not the grid file is formatted
 701    
 702    Returns
 703    -------
 704    int
 705        number of docking trials 
 706    """
 707    ## Prepare
 708    idxNum = 1
 709    idxCopy = 1
 710    ligRotamerPDB = './ligand_rotamer.pdb'
 711    hardSet = {'selection': flexSel, 'flag_form' : flag_form, 'gridFile': hardGridFile}
 712    nativeSet = {'selection': flexSel, 'flag_form' : flag_form, 'gridFile': nativeGridFile}
 713    _mkdir_(placementDir)
 714    cmd = '''
 715          obrotamer %s | convpdb.pl -segnames -setseg %s > %s 
 716          ''' % (ligPDB, ligSeg, ligRotamerPDB)
 717
 718    ## Loop and save poses in the save dir
 719    while idxNum <= num:
 720
 721        ## Read in random conformer and run brief minimization
 722        system(cmd)
 723        read.coor_card(receptorCard, selection = receptorSel)
 724        read.pdb(ligRotamerPDB, resid = True)
 725        minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.01)
 726        minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.005)
 727        totalener = threshold + energy.get_total()
 728
 729        ## Save conformer and side chain conformer
 730        allCoor = coor.get_positions()
 731        allCoor['atomIndex'] = np.arange(np.shape(list(ligSel))[0])
 732        ligand_xyz = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(ligSel)), ['x', 'y', 'z']]
 733        receptor_xyz = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(receptorSel)), ['x', 'y', 'z', 'atomIndex']]
 734
 735        ## Random translation and rotation and minimize in grids. 
 736        i = 1
 737        while i <= copy:
 738
 739            ## Random rotation and translation
 740            new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(rand_rot_trans(ligand_xyz.to_numpy()), columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 741            new_xyz['atomIndex'] = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(ligSel)), 'atomIndex'].to_numpy()
 742            new_xyz = pd.concat([receptor_xyz, new_xyz], ignore_index = True)
 743            new_xyz = new_xyz.sort_values(by = ['atomIndex'], ignore_index = True)[['x', 'y', 'z']]
 744            coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
 745
 746            ## Minimize in Grids
 747            hardGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
 748            hardGrid.setVar(hardSet)
 749            hardGrid.read()
 750            minimize.run_sd(nstep = 100)
 751            minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 500, tolenr = 0.01)
 752            hardGrid.off()
 753            hardGrid.clear()
 754
 755            nativeGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
 756            nativeGrid.setVar(nativeSet)
 757            nativeGrid.read()
 758            minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50)
 759            minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 100, tolenr = 0.01)
 760            nativeGrid.off()
 761            nativeGrid.clear()
 762
 763            ## Check energy
 764            energy.show()
 765            if energy.get_total() < totalener:
 766                print("Flexible receptor + ligand placement ", str(idxCopy))
 767                write.coor_pdb(placementDir + str(idxCopy) + ".pdb", title = '''Title
 768                * The conformer ID is %d
 769                * The placement ID is %d
 770                * The score is %8.6f and cutoff is %8.6f '''
 771                % (idxNum, i, energy.get_total(), totalener))
 772                idxCopy += 1
 773                i += 1
 774
 775        idxNum += 1
 776    return num * copy
 777
 778def FCDOCKER_fast_init_place(receptorPDB='./protein.pdb', receptorPSF='./protein.psf',
 779                             ligPDB='./ligand.pdb', ligSeg='LIGA', placementDir='./placement/',
 780                             exhaustiveness='high', num = 20, copy = 25):
 781    """Rigid CDOCKER fast initial placement
 782
 783    Parameters
 784    ----------
 785    receptorPDB: str
 786              protein pdb file name
 787    receptorPSF: str
 788              protein psf file name
 789    ligPDB: str
 790             ligand pdb file name
 791    ligSeg: str
 792             ligand segment ID
 793    placementDir: str
 794                   placement folder name
 795    exhaustiveness: str
 796                     exhaustiveness for fast placement, high, medium, low
 797    num: int
 798           number of conformer
 799    copy: int
 800           number of copies for each conformer
 801    Returns
 802    -------
 803    int
 804           number of docking trials
 805    """
 806    ## Protein grid information
 807    if psf.get_natom() > 0: psf.delete_atoms()
 808    read.psf_card(receptorPSF, append = True)
 809    read.pdb(receptorPDB, resid = True)
 810    xyz = coor.get_positions().to_numpy()
 811    protCenter = (np.amin(xyz, axis = 0) + np.max(xyz, axis = 0)) / 2
 812    xyz = xyz - protCenter
 813    size, protGrid = _prot_grid(xyz)
 814
 815    ## Build ligand
 816    psf.delete_atoms()
 817    read.sequence_pdb(ligPDB)
 818    settings.set_bomb_level(-1)  ## for 3-mem ring
 819    gen.new_segment(seg_name = ligSeg)
 820    settings.set_bomb_level(0)
 821    read.pdb(ligPDB, resid = True)
 822    num_atom = psf.get_natom()
 823
 824    ## Prepare
 825    idxNum = 1
 826    ligRotamerPDB = './ligand_rotamer.pdb'
 827    _mkdir_(placementDir)
 828    cmd = '''
 829          obrotamer %s | convpdb.pl -segnames -setseg %s > %s 
 830          ''' % (ligPDB, ligSeg, ligRotamerPDB)
 831
 832    ## Check cutoff, default is high
 833    if exhaustiveness == 'high':
 834        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.1) + 1
 835    elif exhaustiveness == 'medium':
 836        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.2) + 1
 837    elif exhaustiveness == 'low':
 838        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.5) + 1
 839    else:
 840        cutoff = int(num_atom * 0.1) + 1
 841
 842    ## Loop through conformers
 843    ommCopy = 1
 844    while idxNum <= num:
 845
 846        ## Read in random conformer
 847        system(cmd)
 848        read.pdb(ligRotamerPDB, resid = True)
 849        xyz = coor.get_positions().to_numpy()
 850
 851        ## Now start placement and save result
 852        idxCopy = 1
 853        while idxCopy <= copy / 5:
 854
 855            ## Find initial conformer place
 856            tmp_xyz = rand_rot_trans(xyz)
 857            ligGrid = _lig_grid(tmp_xyz, size, protCenter)
 858            conformer_score = np.sum(protGrid * ligGrid)
 859            if conformer_score <= cutoff:
 860                conformer_xyz = tmp_xyz
 861                tmpidx = 1
 862
 863                ## Mutate conformer position, save pose based on probability
 864                while tmpidx <= 5:
 865                    tmp_xyz = rand_rot_trans(xyz, max_rot = pi / 6, max_trans = 1)
 866                    ligGrid = _lig_grid(tmp_xyz, size, protCenter)
 867                    score = conformer_score - np.sum(protGrid * ligGrid)
 868                    prob = exp(score)
 869                    rand = random()
 870
 871                    if prob > rand:
 872                        new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(tmp_xyz, columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
 873                        coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
 874                        print("Ligand placement ", str(ommCopy))
 875                        write.coor_pdb(placementDir + str(ommCopy) + ".pdb", title='''Title
 876                        * The conformer ID is %d 
 877                        * Placement ID is %d and mutate ID is %d and the score is %d
 878                        * The exp(score) is %8.6f and cutoff is %8.6f'''
 879                        % (idxNum, ommCopy, tmpidx, score, prob, rand))
 880                        tmpidx += 1
 881                        ommCopy += 1
 882
 883                idxCopy += 1
 884        idxNum += 1
 885    return num * copy
 886
 887def FCDOCKER_mutation(final_result, pair_list, receptorSel = None, flexSel = None,
 888                      ligSel = None, ligPDB = './ligand.pdb', ligSeg = "LIGA",
 889                      saveLig = './ligand/', saveProt = './protein/',
 890                      crossoverLig = './r_ligand/', crossoverProt = './r_protein/',
 891                      hardGridFile = 'grid-emax-3-mine--30-maxe-30.bin',
 892                      nativeGridFile = 'grid-emax-100-mine--100-maxe-100.bin',
 893                      placementDir = './placement/', num= 20, copy = 25, 
 894		      threshold = 100, flag_form = False):
 895    """Mutation in flexible CDOCKER genetic algorithm
 896
 897    Parameters
 898    ----------
 899    final_result: np.array
 900                   analyzed clustering result
 901    pair_list: np.array
 902                pair list of the crossover result
 903    receptorSel: str 
 904                  receptor selection 
 905    flexSel: str
 906              flexible part selection
 907    ligSel: str
 908             ligand selection 
 909    ligPDB: str
 910             ligand pdb file name
 911    ligSeg: str
 912             ligand segment ID
 913    saveLig: str
 914              ligand docked result saved folder name
 915    saveProt: str
 916               protein docked result saved folder name
 917    crossoverLig: str
 918                   crossover ligand folder before mutation
 919    crossoverProt: str
 920                    crossover protein folder before mutation
 921    hardGridFile: str
 922                   hard grid file name 
 923    nativeGridFile: str
 924                     native grid file name 
 925    placementDir: str
 926                   placement folder after mutation
 927    num: float
 928          number of conformer 
 929    copy: float
 930           number of copies for each conformer 
 931    threshold: float
 932                threshold for energy cutoff
 933    flag_form: bool
 934                whether or not the grid file is formatted
 935
 936    Returns
 937    -------
 938    int
 939        number of docking trials 
 940
 941    """
 942    ## Prepare
 943    idxCopy = 1
 944    hardSet = {'selection': flexSel, 'flag_form' : flag_form, 'gridFile': hardGridFile}
 945    nativeSet = {'selection': flexSel, 'flag_form' : flag_form, 'gridFile': nativeGridFile}
 946    _mkdir_(placementDir)
 947
 948    ## Get cutoff energy
 949    tmpener = []
 950    for parent in final_result[:, 0]:
 951        read.pdb(saveLig + str(parent) + ".pdb", resid = True)
 952        read.pdb(saveProt + str(parent) + ".pdb", resid = True)
 953        minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.01)
 954        minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.005)
 955        tmpener.append(energy.get_total())
 956    totalEner = np.amax(np.asarray(tmpener))
 957    mutateEner = totalEner + threshold
 958
 959    ## Loop and save poses in the save dir
 960    while idxCopy <= num * copy:
 961
 962        ## Read in ligand - protein random crossover position 
 963        ligandID = pair_list[idxCopy - 1, 0]
 964        proteinID = pair_list[idxCopy - 1, 1]
 965        read.pdb(crossoverLig + str(ligandID) + ".pdb", resid = True)
 966        read.pdb(crossoverProt + str(proteinID) + ".pdb", resid = True)
 967        minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.01)
 968        minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 50, tolenr = 0.005)
 969
 970        ## Compute energy difference
 971        ## Mutation probility cutoff based on energy difference 
 972        DEner = energy.get_total() - totalEner
 973        prob = _mutate_prob_(DEner)
 974        rand = random()
 975
 976        ## No mutation if random number smaller than the prob cutoff 
 977        if rand <= prob:
 978            print("Flexible receptor + ligand placement ", str(idxCopy))
 979            write.coor_pdb(placementDir + str(idxCopy) + ".pdb", titel = '''Title
 980            * The ligand ID is %d
 981            * The protein ID is %d
 982            * The placement ID is %d
 983            * The energy difference is %8.6f 
 984            * The mutate score is %8.6f and cutoff is %8.6f
 985            * No mutation applied'''
 986            % (ligandID, proteinID, idxCopy, DEner, rand, prob))
 987            idxCopy += 1
 988
 989        ## Perform mutation if random number smaller than the prob cutoff 
 990        else:
 991
 992            ## Save conformer and side chain conformer
 993            randomEner = mutateEner
 994            allCoor = coor.get_positions()
 995            allCoor['atomIndex'] = np.arange(np.shape(list(ligSel))[0])
 996            ligand_xyz = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(ligSel)), ['x', 'y', 'z']]
 997            receptor_xyz = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(receptorSel)), ['x', 'y', 'z', 'atomIndex']]
 998
 999            ## Random translation and rotation and minimize in grids. 
1000            while randomEner >= mutateEner:
1001
1002                ## Random rotation and translation
1003                new_receptor = receptor_xyz
1004                new_xyz = pd.DataFrame(rand_rot_trans(ligand_xyz.to_numpy(), max_rot = pi / 6), columns = ['x', 'y', 'z'])
1005                new_xyz['atomIndex'] = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(ligSel)), 'atomIndex'].to_numpy()
1006                new_xyz = pd.concat([new_receptor, new_xyz], ignore_index = True)
1007                new_xyz = new_xyz.sort_values(by = ['atomIndex'], ignore_index = True)[['x', 'y', 'z']]
1008                coor.set_positions(new_xyz)
1009
1010                ## Minimize in Grids
1011                hardGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
1012                hardGrid.setVar(hardSet)
1013                hardGrid.read()
1014                minimize.run_sd(nstep = 100)
1015                minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 500, tolenr = 0.01)
1016                hardGrid.off()
1017                hardGrid.clear()
1018
1019                nativeGrid = grid.CDOCKER()
1020                nativeGrid.setVar(nativeSet)
1021                nativeGrid.read()
1022                minimize.run_sd(nstep = 50)
1023                minimize.run_abnr(nstep = 100, tolenr = 0.01)
1024                nativeGrid.off()
1025                nativeGrid.clear()
1026
1027                ## Check energy
1028                energy.show()
1029                randomEner = energy.get_total()
1030
1031            ## Save mutated pose 
1032            print("Flexible receptor + ligand placement ", str(idxCopy))
1033            write.coor_pdb(placementDir + str(idxCopy) + ".pdb", titel = '''Title
1034            * The ligand ID is %d
1035            * The protein ID is %d
1036            * The placement ID is %d
1037            * The energy difference is %8.6f 
1038            * The mutate score is %8.6f and cutoff is %8.6f
1039            * After mutation
1040            * The total energy is %8.6f
1041            * The cutoff energy is %8.6f'''
1042            % (ligandID, proteinID, idxCopy, DEner, rand, prob, randomEner, mutateEner))
1043            idxCopy += 1
1044
1045    return num * copy
1046
1047def FCDOCKER_crossover(cluster_result, dock_result, num = 20, copy = 25):
1048    """Crossover in flexible CDOCKER genetic algorithm
1049
1050    Parameters
1051    ----------
1052    cluster_result: np.array
1053                     clustering result using MMTSB
1054    dock_result: np.array
1055                  docking results with grid energy recorded
1056    num: float
1057          number of conformer 
1058    copy: float
1059           number of copies for each conformer 
1060
1061    Returns
1062    -------
1063    final_result: np.array
1064          analyzed clustering result
1065    np.array
1066          pair list of the crossover result
1067    """
1068    ## Sort cluster result
1069    clusterIdx = np.unique(cluster_result[:, 1])
1070    final_result = np.ones((len(clusterIdx), 2))
1071    for cluster in clusterIdx:
1072        tmpEner = []
1073        pdbIdx = cluster_result[cluster_result[:, 1] == cluster][:, 0]
1074        for pdb in pdbIdx:
1075            tmpEner.append(dock_result[dock_result[:, 1] == pdb][:, 0])
1076        cResult= pd.DataFrame()
1077        cResult['PDB'] = np.asarray(pdbIdx)
1078        cResult['Energy'] = np.asarray(tmpEner)
1079        cResult = cResult.sort_values(by = ['Energy'], ignore_index = True)
1080        final_result[cluster - 1, 0] = cResult.iloc[0]['PDB']
1081        final_result[cluster - 1, 1] = len(tmpEner)
1082        final_result = final_result.astype(int)
1083
1084    ## Perpare for crossover
1085    total = num * copy
1086    comb_pair = total // 4
1087    self_pair = total - comb_pair * 2
1088    idx = final_result[:, 0]
1089    count = final_result[:, 1]
1090
1091    ## Random crossover 
1092    tmp1 = choices(idx, weights = count, k = comb_pair)
1093    tmp2 = choices(idx, weights = count, k = comb_pair)
1094    tmp3 = choices(idx, weights = count, k = self_pair)
1095
1096    ## Create protein-ligand list
1097    total_list = np.zeros((total, 2))
1098    for i in np.arange(comb_pair):
1099        j = 2 * i
1100        k = 2 * i + 1
1101        total_list[j, 0] = tmp1[i]
1102        total_list[k, 0] = tmp2[i]
1103        total_list[j, 1] = tmp2[i]
1104        total_list[k, 1] = tmp1[i]
1105        i += 1
1106
1107    for i in np.arange(self_pair): total_list[comb_pair * 2 + i, :] = tmp3[i]
1108    return final_result, total_list.astype(int)
1109
1110def FCDOCKER_calc_dihedral(flexchain, cluster_result, saveProt, protein_dihedral):
1111    """Calculate dihedral angle and corresponding entropy in flexible docking
1112
1113    Parameters
1114    ----------
1115    flexchain: pd.DataFrame
1116                dataframe of the flexchain selection
1117    cluster_result: np.array
1118                     clustering result using MMTSB
1119    saveProt: str
1120               protein docked result saved folder name
1121    protein_dihedral: pd.DataFrame
1122                       protein dihedral angle look up table
1123
1124    Returns
1125    -------
1126    entropy : np.array
1127            entropy for each cluster 
1128    np.array
1129            cluster ID
1130    sc_entropy: np.array
1131            entropy for each cluster & each amino acid
1132    """
1133    ## Create entropy dataframe
1134    sc_entropy = np.zeros((len(np.unique(cluster_result[:, 1])), len(flexchain)))
1135    
1136    ## Loop through flexible chains 
1137    for idx, row in flexchain.iterrows():
1138        tmp = pycharmm.SelectAtoms().by_res_and_type(row['seg_id'],
1139                                     str(row['res_id']), 'C')
1140        resname = tmp.get_res_names()[0]
1141        atoms = protein_dihedral.loc[protein_dihedral['Amino_acid'] == resname].to_numpy()
1142        if (len(atoms) > 0):
1143            tmp_result = np.zeros((len(cluster_result), len(atoms) + 1))
1144            print("Calculate conformational entropy contribution from amino acid ", resname)
1145
1146            ## Loop through clustered pdbs
1147            for trial in np.arange(len(cluster_result)):
1148                pdbID = cluster_result[trial, 0]
1149                read.pdb(saveProt + str(pdbID) + ".pdb", resid = True)
1150                allCoor = coor.get_positions()
1151
1152                for dihe_set in np.arange(len(atoms)): 
1153                    dihe = pycharmm.SelectAtoms().by_res_and_type(row['seg_id'],
1154                                    str(row['res_id']), atoms[dihe_set, 1])
1155                    xyz = allCoor.loc[np.asarray(list(dihe))].to_numpy()
1156                    tmp_result[trial, dihe_set] = calc_dihedral(xyz)
1157            
1158            ## Post processing
1159            if resname != 'PHE' or resname != 'TYR':
1160                tmp_result[(tmp_result >= 0) & (tmp_result < 120)] = 1
1161                tmp_result[(tmp_result > -120) & (tmp_result < 0)] = 2
1162                tmp_result[(tmp_result <= -120) | (tmp_result >= 120)] = 3
1163            else:
1164                tmp_result[:, 0][(tmp_result[:, 0] >= 0) & (tmp_result[:, 0] < 120)] = 1
1165                tmp_result[:, 0][(tmp_result[:, 0] > -120) & (tmp_result[:, 0] < 0)] = 2
1166                tmp_result[:, 0][(tmp_result[:, 0] <= -120) | (tmp_result[:, 0] >= 120)] = 3
1167
1168                tmp_result[:, 1][(tmp_result[:, 1] >= -45) & (tmp_result[:, 1] <= 45)] = 0
1169                tmp_result[:, 1][(tmp_result[:, 1] < -135) | (tmp_result[:, 1] > 135)] = 0
1170                tmp_result[:, 1][(tmp_result[:, 1] >= -135) & (tmp_result[:, 1] < -45)] = 1
1171                tmp_result[:, 1][(tmp_result[:, 1] > 45) & (tmp_result[:, 1] <= 135)] = 1
1172            tmp_result[:, dihe_set + 1] = cluster_result[:, 1]
1173
1174            for trial in np.unique(cluster_result[:, 1]):
1175                tmp_total = []
1176                tmpEntropy = tmp_result[tmp_result[:, -1] == trial][:, 0:len(atoms)]
1177                tmp_total.append(len(tmpEntropy))
1178                state = np.unique(tmpEntropy, axis = 0)
1179                for tmpI in np.arange(len(state)):
1180                    tmp_total.append(np.sum((tmpEntropy == state[tmpI]).all(axis = 1)))
1181
1182                tmp_total = np.asarray(tmp_total)
1183                tmp_total = tmp_total / tmp_total[0]
1184                result = np.sum(tmp_total * np.log(tmp_total))
1185                sc_entropy[trial - 1, idx] = result
1186
1187    entropy = np.sum(sc_entropy, axis = 1) * 0.593
1188    return entropy, np.unique(cluster_result[:, 1]), sc_entropy
1189
1190## Define default simulated annealing
1191def default_ommd_sian(ommd):
1192    """Default OpenMM docking simulated annealing 
1193
1194    Parameters
1195    ----------
1196    ommd : pycharmm.grid.OMMD
1197           OpenMM docking system 
1198
1199    Returns
1200    -------
1201    bool 
1202         True for success
1203    """
1204    ## Stage 1 
1205    ommdSet = {'soft': 1, 'hard': 0, 'emax': 0.6, 
1206               'mine': -0.4, 'maxe': 0.4, 'eps': 3}
1207    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1208    ommd.change_softness()
1209    ommdSet = {'steps': 3000, 'heatFrq': 50, 'startTemp': 300, 
1210               'endTemp': 700, 'incrTemp': 1}
1211    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1212    ommd.simulated_annealing()
1213
1214    ## Stage 2
1215    ommdSet = {'soft': 1, 'hard': 0, 'emax': 0.6, 
1216               'mine': -0.4, 'maxe': 0.4, 'eps': 3}
1217    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1218    ommd.change_softness()
1219    ommdSet = {'steps': 14000, 'heatFrq': 50, 'startTemp': 700, 
1220               'endTemp': 300, 'incrTemp': -1}
1221    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1222    ommd.simulated_annealing()
1223
1224    ## Stage 3
1225    ommdSet = {'soft': 0, 'hard': 1, 'emax': 3, 
1226               'mine': -30, 'maxe': 30, 'eps': 3}
1227    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1228    ommd.change_softness()
1229    ommdSet = {'steps': 7000, 'heatFrq': 50, 'startTemp': 500, 
1230               'endTemp': 300, 'incrTemp': -1}
1231    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1232    ommd.simulated_annealing()
1233
1234    ## Stage 4
1235    ommdSet = {'soft': 0, 'hard': 1, 'emax': 30, 
1236               'mine': -300, 'maxe': 300, 'eps': 3}
1237    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1238    ommd.change_softness()
1239    ommdSet = {'steps': 3000, 'heatFrq': 50, 'startTemp': 400, 
1240               'endTemp': 50, 'incrTemp': -1}
1241    ommd.setVar(ommdSet)
1242    ommd.simulated_annealing()
1243
1244    return True

1246## Clustering method
1247def cluster_mmtsb(radius, name): 
1248    """Use MMTSB to perfrom clustering (cluster.pl)
1249
1250    Parameters
1251    ----------
1252    radius : float 
1253             clustering radius 
1254    name : str
1255           name of the ligand pdbs
1256
1257    Returns
1258    -------
1259    message : str 
1260        clustering results 
1261    """
1262    if type(name) != str: name = str(name)
1263    cluster_cmd = "cluster.pl -kclust -nolsqfit -radius " + str(radius) + " -selmode heavy " + name + "> cluster.log"
1264    status = system(cluster_cmd)
1265
1266    if status == 0:
1267        message = "Clustering docked pose " + name + " with raidus " + str(radius) + " succeed."
1268    else:
1269        message = "Something wrong with the clustering method, please check."
1270    
1271    return message
1272
1273def scan_cluster_radius(name):
1274    """Find the best clustering radius
1275    Default use in rigid CDOCKER
1276
1277    Parameters
1278    ----------
1279    name: str
1280           name of the ligand pdbs
1281
1282    Returns
1283    -------
1284    radius : float
1285          best clustering radius 
1286    """
1287    ## Prepare file
1288    _rm_('tmpcluster')
1289
1290    ## Scan clustering radius
1291    if type(name) != str: name = str(name)
1292    radii = np.arange(5, 21, 1) / 10
1293    sort_cluster_cmd = "grep @cluster cluster.log | sed 1d | sort -gk 4 | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $4}' >> tmpcluster"
1294    for radius in radii:
1295        cluster_mmtsb(radius, name)
1296        system(sort_cluster_cmd)
1297
1298    ## Find the best clustering radius
1299    cluster_size = np.loadtxt('tmpcluster', dtype = int)
1300    radius = radii[cluster_size == np.amax(cluster_size)][0]
1301
1302    return radius 
1303
1304def rcdocker_default_sort(radius, name): 
1305    """Rigid CDOCKER default sorting methods
1306
1307    Parameters
1308    ----------
1309    radius : float 
1310             clustering radius 
1311    name : str
1312           name of the ligand pdbs
1313
1314    Returns
1315    -------
1316    np.array 
1317          clustering result 
1318    """
1319    if type(name) != str: name = str(name)
1320    cluster_mmtsb(radius, name)
1321
1322    cmd = '''
1323    init=`grep @cluster cluster.log | sed 1d | sort -gk 4 | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $2}' | cut -b 3-`
1324    final=$[init+1]
1325    awk "/cluster t.$init /, /cluster t.$final / {print}" cluster.log | sed /cluster/d | awk '{print $2}' > tmp
1326    '''
1327    system(cmd)
1328    
1329    return np.loadtxt('tmp', dtype = str) 
1330
1331def sort_cluster(pdb_files, dock_result, sort_method):
1332    """Sort clustering results
1333
1334    Parameters
1335    ----------
1336    pdb_files : np.array 
1337                pdb names of docked poses 
1338    dock_result : pd.DataFrame
1339                  docking results (i.e., energy)
1340    sort_method : str
1341                  sorting based on sort_method
1342
1343    Returns
1344    -------
1345    tmpResult: pd.DataFrame
1346         sorted results  
1347    """
1348    tmpEner = []
1349    cluster_size = np.size(pdb_files)
1350    if cluster_size > 1:
1351        for poseID in pdb_files: 
1352            tmpEner.append(dock_result[dock_result['PDB_name'] == poseID][sort_method].values[0])
1353 
1354        tmpEner = np.asarray(tmpEner)
1355        minPose = pdb_files[tmpEner == np.amin(tmpEner)][0]
1356        tmpResult = dock_result[dock_result['PDB_name'] == minPose]
1357    else:
1358        print("Cluster only have one cluster member")
1359        tmpResult = dock_result[dock_result['PDB_name'] == pdb_files]
1360
1361    tmp = pd.DataFrame(np.asarray([cluster_size]), columns = ['cluster_size'])
1362    tmp = tmp.astype(str)
1363    tmpResult = tmpResult.join(tmp.set_index(tmpResult.index))
1364    return tmpResult 
1365
1366def top_N_cluster(logFile = 'cluster.log', N = 10, total = 500):
1367    """Get top N largest clusters
1368    
1369    Parameters
1370    ----------
1371    logFile : str
1372              cluster log file
1373    N : int
1374        number of large cluster identified
1375
1376    Returns
1377    -------
1378    np.array
1379          sorted top N cluster results  
1380    """
1381    cutoff = int(np.ceil(total / 100) - 1)
1382    if cutoff <= 1: cutoff = 1
1383    cmd = '''
1384    idx=1
1385    rm -f cluster_list 
1386    grep @cluster %s | sed 1d | awk '{if ($4 > %d) print}' | sort -nk 4 | tail -n %d | awk '{print $2}' | cut -b 3- > tmplist
1387    for init in `cat tmplist`; do
1388        final=$[init+1]
1389        awk "/cluster t.$init /, /cluster t.$final / {print}" %s | sed /cluster/d | awk '{print $2}' > tmp
1390        awk '{$2 = name; print}' name=$idx tmp >> cluster_list
1391        idx=$[idx+1]
1392        done
1393    ''' % (logFile, cutoff, N, logFile)
1394    system(cmd)
1395    try:
1396        cluster_list = np.loadtxt("cluster_list", dtype = int)
1397        return np.loadtxt("cluster_list", dtype = int)
1398    except IOError:
1399        print("All clusters have a cluster number of 1, please increase docking trials")
1400        return False

1402def _fcdocker_cluster_check_(logFile = 'cluster.log', total = 500):
1403    """Check number of clusters with cluster number greater than 1
1404    Parameters
1405    ----------
1406    logFile : str
1407              cluster log file
1408
1409    Returns
1410    -------
1411    int 
1412       number of clusters with cluster number greater than 1 
1413    """
1414    cutoff = int(np.ceil(total / 100) - 1)
1415    if cutoff <= 1: cutoff = 1
1416    cmd = '''
1417    rm -f cluster_list
1418    grep @cluster %s | sed 1d | awk '{if ($4 > %d) print}' | wc -l > cluster_list
1419    ''' % (logFile, cutoff)
1420    system(cmd)
1421    return int(np.loadtxt("cluster_list", dtype = int))

1423################################################################
